title: 114_s2854
content: The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 amends the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crime Act of 2007 to meet regularly with eligible entities, support the accounting of victims of racially motivated crimes, and hold perpetrators accountable under Federal and State law. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 aims to address unsolved civil rights murders and disappearances by expressing condolences, keeping families informed, and complying with information requests. It also amends the original act to extend the timeline for investigations. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 is amended to update the timeline for investigations and allow for the review of closed cases involving violations without in-person investigations. Public engagement meetings are also required by the Department. The Department will hold meetings with various entities to discuss the progress of work under the Act. An additional $1,500,000 is authorized for the Attorney General annually for this purpose.
